creator: vsrpathuri@yahoo.com
text: Is it possible to have an SSH capability under present FTP optional task ?

creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text:
an SSH task is already on the wish list for future versions of ant, as seen in 
the task list for the ant2.0 requirements.

In the meantime, you may be able to get away with your deployment problems by 
using the mindspring SSH client http://www.isnetworks.com/ssh/) and setting it 
up to 'tunnel'; under the tunnel menu you can get it to tunnel telnet or FTP 
over the SSH connection; your task does an FTP to some port on localhost and 
the SSH app tunnels it over to the far end. 

Of course, if you do want to write an SSH task for use today, many of us would 
be grateful, though not of course my operations colleagues who view the fact 
that we engineers know the deployed system passwords with some concern; if 
they thought we could deploy to production from inside the IDE they would be 
really worried:-)
